description.narrative: By the end of 2018, the National Education Sector plan is implemented and significant progress is made on major reforms, sector coordination is strengthened and planning of the last phase of the ESP is on progress in order to improve quality and efficiency by better governance of the sector and reduced repetition and dropout rates.

sector.narrative: Education Management Information System (EMIS) (excluding learning assessment systems)
Education Management Information System (EMIS) (excluding learning assessment systems)
Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Provision of parental education for school readiness (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of skills development for adolescents (10-19 year-olds) (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision or procurement of primary education learning materials
System strengthening - curricula and learning materials design (excluding early-learning / pre-primary)
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

title.narrative: Burundi United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Burundi Country Programme Document 2010-2014 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Burundi 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Burundi Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2018, the National Education Sector plan is implemented and significant progress is made on major reforms, sector coordination is strengthened and planning of the last phase of the ESP is on progress in order to improve quality and efficiency by better governance of the sector and reduced repetition and dropout rates.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to strengthen the enabling environment to support the implementation of sector Policies/Plans. UNICEF was able to roll out an inclusive and participatory policy dialogue through a strengthened sector coordination mechanism, while revitalized the Local Education Group. This resulted in the development of a new Education Transition Plan. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018

title.narrative: System Strengthening - EMIS - Availability of an Education Management Information System that transparently feeds findings back to communities or school management committees - score (1-4), see guidance
Availability of annual education statistical update
System Strengthening - Education sector planning - Education Sector Plan or Transitional Education Sector Plan developed with UNICEF support available
System Strengthening - Education sector planning - Education sector analysis, financial simulation model or medium term expenditure framework developed with UNICEF support
National MIS produces quaterly reports / dashboards on performance against key indicators for all districts within 6 months

actual.value: 2018:Yearly reports have been developed, timeliness is improving

title.narrative: National education sector plan/policies supports a minimum package of gender-responsive teaching and learning
